author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court has warned the State government that it would be constrained to quash its order regularising encroachments made on water bodies, if a reply is not filed by Friday on a Public Interest Litigation petition pending on the issue.

The First Bench of Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice M.M Sundresh made the observation while hearing the petition moved by Sivakasi Region Tax Payers Association seeking to quash the GO.

The petitioner claimed that water bodies are being encroached upon by persons under the pretext of poverty, landlessness with the support of ruling parties, obstructing water source poromboke lands and water supply channels.

Noting that the term ‘regularisation’ would mean setting right an irregularity emerged in any manner out of an existing legal right, the petitioner said, “An illegality or an act expressly forbidden by law should not be justified.”

When the PIL came up for hearing on Wednesday, the Bench noted that the issue of regularising encroachment on water bodies has already been declared as illegal by a Full Bench of the High Court through a order dated December 15, 2015.

Concerned over the government’s failure to take a stand on the issue, the Bench said, “As usual, the government has not spelled out its stand on the GO.”

Government directed to file reply today on a PIL plea pending

on the issue
title: Will quash order regularising encroachments on water bodies: HC
